review: I was torn between the Roku, Google and Amazon versions of what is (essentially) the same product.  My enrollment in Amazon Prime pointed me to the Fire TV Stick, and it turned out to be a great value.  The streaming quality exceed that of Netflix using wireless (Netflix on my Samsung Smart TV looks pretty grainy over wireless), and I have access to Amazon Prime Instant Video, which rules.

review: while the setup was simple enough. The device apps are so few that i find i usually use only netflix and occassionally amazons app. Unless u have amazon prime for the movies i am not impressed. Ive found that roku offers far more app options but most of them are useless apps as well. Whats needed is more cable tv channel apps and that would attract more buyers and watchers. I am not by any means happy with cable or satelite companies which is why i like streaming options. I just want better amazon prices, choices and for free . I have no problem paying for prime if i actually saw anything i wanted to watch. Hulu plus offers best tv options but again paying for three streaming comanies is annoying!! Why cant someone combine all three of the best at one price with massive options. Now that i would really like! One last notation.. i dont like having to have a separate router and the comcast router and the stick in order to get stick service. I love the stick itself..no cords...but hate needing two routers. I love amazons movie options.

review: The Fire Stick and its remote is sleek and cool looking. Setup was very simple. Connecting the device to my Amazon, Netflix, Pandora, and Hulu accounts was very simple. Navigation of the menus is easy and intuitive. The remote is surprisingly responsive when it come to the games you can play. On the down side--I didn't look over the product close enough so when I found it came with a power cord my fantasies of mobility drained away. I know it doesn't make it impossible to move from TV to TV but its not going to be as quick and easy as I imagined it to be
author: ZugZug

review: So far, so good. Set-up was simple. I got this for my bedroom TV to compliment the ROKU that I have for my living room TV. For only $20 (pre-release deal Prime members were offered two months ago) this thing was a steal. Everything works as expected and the visual aspect (on-screen displays) of the Amazon Stick is pretty rad. When you're not watching TV for a while, the screensaver mode rotates breathtaking pictures of nature in HD, which is really cool for nerds like myself.This thing will serve as a great holiday gift for your friends with WiFi and a subscription to Netflix and Hulu Plus. Especially for those who use gaming devices for such activities.
